metadata.label: title
metadata.value: [Houston West case testimonies]: Department of the Interior, Commission to the Five Civilized Tribes, Ft. Gibson, September 4, 1901 [2 copies]

metadata.label: abstract
metadata.value: W.T. Harnage, Ezekiel Harnage, and D.M. Falkner testify on behalf of Houston West, a formerly enslaved African American, for enrollment as a Cherokee Freedman.  W.T. Harnage, a "Cherokee citizen by blood" testifies that he is the nephew of Houston West's former enslaver, Walker Mayfield, and that Walker returned from Texas to the Sequoyah District in the Cherokee Nation 1867.  Ezekiel Harnage, the cousin of W.T. Harnage, testifies that both he and W.T. Harnage were in Texas during the Civil War, and that he knew Houston West. D.M. Falkner, another "Cherokee by blood" testifies that he married Rachel L. Adair, who claimed to be the niece of Walker Mayfield.

metadata.label: Title
metadata.value: [Houston West case testimonies]: Department of the Interior, Commission to the Five Civilized Tribes, Ft. Gibson, September 4, 1901 [2 copies]

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: W.T. Harnage, Ezekiel Harnage, and D.M. Falkner testify on behalf of Houston West, a formerly enslaved African American, for enrollment as a Cherokee Freedman. W.T. Harnage, a "Cherokee citizen by blood" testifies that he is the nephew of Houston West's former enslaver, Walker Mayfield, and that Walker returned from Texas to the Sequoyah District in the Cherokee Nation 1867. Ezekiel Harnage, the cousin of W.T. Harnage, testifies that both he and W.T. Harnage were in Texas during the Civil War, and that he knew Houston West. D.M. Falkner, another "Cherokee by blood" testifies that he married Rachel L. Adair, who claimed to be the niece of Walker Mayfield.
